data.title: A home
data.text:
I am staying at Hinds House while my new place is being ready to move into.  It has been two weeks so far and I love it. The setup is like a Bed and Breakfast, except you do the cooking.  There is an spacious kitchen with everything you can possible need to.  You only need to buy your groceries.  Lots of common rooms; but still with the ability to have your own privacy. My bedroom (#1) is just wonderful; love the tub, and the balcony where I sit to read.  I feel like a royal, living in this wonderful antique Victorian House. I feel so relax and peaceful. 
Please note, this is a Victorian House with its antique furniture and rooms alike.  Don't expect a New Wave house.
I was struggling trying to find a temporary place to stay, one that is safe and clean.  The Hinds House has giving me a wonderful peace of mind.  I will come back to this home any time I want a stay-vacation. 
I will highly recommend this place.

data.title: Hinds House Stay
data.text: The Hinds house is a nice Victorian house just a few blocks from the Pacific Garden Mall and the Boardwalk.  Rooms #1 and #2 are the only rooms with a private bath.  It is an interesting experience there, it depends heavily on the other guests staying.  The kitchen is well stocked with the basic pots and pans, coffee is provided, storage for your groceries is ample, in cupboards and fridge.  This is not a hotel. Laundry is provided, as is the detergent.  So if you need your bedding changed, you will need to wash it. If you need your room cleaned, there are supplies and vacuums available. It is a weekly rental, and we just finished a 1 month stay.  We would stay again.  The common areas of the house are very nice, a great chance to stay in a well maintained Victorian house near downtown Santa Cruz.  A parking permit is also provided while you stay which is a nice bonus, there are only 3 parking spots off street at the property.

data.title: Wonderful, homey B and B
data.text: This is a wonderful inn, very close to the main street of the town. The setup is well thought out, self-catered, long term occupancy rental/short term stay inn, and the rooms are really wonderful. we'll definitely be back.

data.title: A Home Away From Home
data.text: I spent 2 weeks at Hinds House and the stay was the most delightful I have ever had while travelling! The amenities are amazing. You have allocated cupboards and fridge space so that you can cook your own meals, which is great for those of use who have specific dietary needs that eating out cannot accommodate. Washer/Dryer available that is included, super clean house and rooms. The bed was very comfortable and fresh, and more than enough space to put all of my clothing and personal items. The location is unbeatable. You are a 3 minute walk to downtown and all of the shops, restaurants, groceries and transit. Only a 15 minute walk to the beach, Wharf and Boardwalk. Plus it's a beautiful home and city! Safe, friendly and full of amazingly unique shops for vintage lovers and modern store lovers combined. Oh and free wifi! Thank you to Hinds house for the amazingly, comfortable stay.

data.title: Location, Comfort and Affordability
data.text: stayed here for one week trip to santa Cruz. It's like going back in time with all the modern comforts...good wifi, hot water, great water pressure and really affordable weekly rates.  There are two remarkable things about this place: the location and the people.  You are right downtown and can walk to everything.  The people here were fantastic. We made friends I know we will keep in touch with. Thanks Hinds House! Wish there were places like this in every town.

data.title: Comfort and Location
data.text: We were put out of our house for a week while having new floors installed in our home.  Looked into local hotels but decided on the Hinds House for their great weekly rates, full kitchen and their downtown location.  We don't live in the city center so being able to walk to everything was a welcome change.  Our room was beautiful and comfortable and the kitchen and laundry meant we didn't have to eat out or go to a Laundromat.  The place is spotless.  The management here cares about this historic place and they keep it up so beautifully.  The place is way cleaner than my house.  We had one of the more affordable rooms with a bathroom across the hall.  The maids cleaned the bathroom every day  Again, cleaner then mine at home.  The Hinds House is our new spot when out of town relative come to stay.  Great place.

data.title: Wow, What a Fabulous Place! Victorian with all Amenities of a 5 Star.
data.text: What a cool concept.  Beautiful house, beautiful rooms, bathroom to spend all day in.  This extended stay sort of combo between a hotel and B & B is perfect for vacation or business.  Fully equipped kitchen for the guests, lovely dining room, comfortable living room with piano, TV room and wi-fi everywhere in the house.  What else could you ask for? Furnishing and decor is without reproach (who owns this place any way?). Cleaning is done when and how I don't know because I never see housekeeping, yet everything is perfect!  Between $70 and $100 per night minimum 7 day stay.  Some rooms have private huge bathroom with claw foot comfy luxurious tub with deck out to terrace.

data.title: Great Option for a stay in Santa Cruz
data.text:
I had originally booked the Adobe on Green Street B&B because of the really great reviews on TripAdvisor, not to mention I love Santa Cruz!  I was quite excited to get an accommodation (on previous occasions they were booked solid) for a night during Labor Day Weekend.  

A few days before leaving, I received a note from the owner of Adobe that he had accidentally over-booked the room at Adobe, however, as a kind gesture, offered me a room here at Hinds House for two nights, FREE.  Yes, I was disappointed at the cancellation at Adobe (wanted to take the g/f for a special weekend), but since other plans were in place, I took up the offer to stay at Hinds House for one night. 

The Hinds House, I believe is more suited to long term stays (weekly/monthly).  It seems like a place visiting professors would stay.   It is an elegantly appointed Victorian home 3 blocks from downtown Santa Cruz.   It is in a very quiet location.   There are 3 levels, I believe, some rooms with private bathrooms and some without.   We stayed on the 2nd level, and, had to walk up to the third floor to use the bathroom.  I couldn't care  less about this, but often times, women do!   Comfortable robes were included in the room, which allows for a comfortable transition from the shower to the bedroom.  

There is a kitchen inside the house, beautiful rooms in which to sit and read a book.  An old antique piano adds to the decor. 

Yes, the beds here are amazing.  Definitely not cheap beds! 

In the rooms, there are small sinks for washing or getting a drink of water.  Also, there is a very well organized binder with a significant amount of tourist information including where to eat, parks, etc.  Very useful.   I used the free wi-fi in the house to get additional information on things to do in Santa Cruz.  There is a computer downstairs for those who are traveling w/o a wi-fi card (complimentary).   Very cool. 

It was a very fun, memorable experience staying in this historical home in Santa Cruz.  

The gentlemen that runs the Hinds House also runs Adobe.  Although I have yet to stay at Adobe, both places are obviously managed VERY well.  I wouldn't hesitate for a second to recommend either place as options in Santa Cruz.   I am definitely looking forward to staying at Adobe next year.

data.title: Very Cool Place
data.text: This is a fantastic deal if you need to be in Santa Cruz for a week or more.  They don't take reservations for a night or two.  The location is perfect.  I didn't have a car and all of the wonders of downtown were three blocks away.  Day or night I could safely walk to everything I needed in a couple minutes.  The house itself is so beautiful, I had to pinch myself each time I walked home.  Could this beautiful Victorian mansion really be where I'm staying? The other guests were friendly, several from Europe.  There is a fully stocked common kitchen which saved me from eating at restaurants all the time.  This place is so well organized and well kept.  I never saw one thing out of place. The rooms are unique and varied: from very inexpensive with bathrooms in the hall to more expensive with bathroom in the room.  Common bathrooms were cleaned every day and well equipped. Even the more expensive rooms are far less than typical hotel prices.  There is free wifi.  I've since looked for a place like this in other towns, but they just don't exist.  For now the Hinds House is a welcome anomaly.  I hope it lives on forever.

data.title: Wish we could stay longer...but watch the stairs
data.text:
I'm looking to avoid repeats of previous postings so I'll just do pros and cons.  Don't forget that this place is for extended stays - not overnite options.  However, the price per week is so fabulous that you'll want to stay the week.

Pros:  
1. We stayed over the Xmas holidays and were very sad to leave.  To quote an earlier Japanese resident, this house has good karma - a really good feel to it.  I've always liked Santa Cruz and this was such a treat.  I've stayed in many places but this is the one place I'd really like to come back to.  

2.  Incredibly and totally unbelievably comfortable beds, Victorian furnishings, multiple full bathrooms scattered throughout the house, well-equipped kitchen for cooking, well marked cabinets and fridges per room, washer/dryer on premises with complimentary washing powder, parking permits for on-stret parking etc., given to you on arrival.  There are three first-come, first serve parking spots behind the house and on-street parking (which we did not have any problems finding).  Think a hostel for grownups - very lovely, comfortable with the ease of coming and going as you like.  Very clean!

3. Great location (4 blocks west of Pacific Avenue that has all sorts of places to eat plus a New Leaf grocery store in the old Bank of Italy building if you prefer to cook).  We recommend Sitar if you like Indian food and for girly hand creams, candles, and makeup, I recommend Farmacy located across the street from Hoffmann's Bakery (which is also yummy).  Everything is within walking distance although West Cliff Drive is further out.  I'd suggest driving out there, parking and then doing the 6 mile round trip walk along the coast.  You can hole up in your room (which is great for writing/research purposes) as they have desks and WiFi or you can mingle downstairs in one of the 2 drawing rooms, dining room or kitchen.

Cons: 
1. We booked a large room with private bath not realizing it was  a bathtub/toilet combo with no venting vs the typical shower/toilet combo. Our fault for not reading closely enough.  We never did use the tub although the private toilet was nice.  However, there are 2 full bathrooms with showers on the 3rd floor, a full bathroom with tub on 2nd floor and a full bathroom with tub on 1st floor off the kitchen.  All rooms have their own sink (if not reserving one of the two private bath facilities).  If you book off season, I recommend taking the shared bathroom option as there was no problems in finding access times to it.  Plus, the shared option is considerably cheaper.  

2. Stairs. This is what gives Hinds House the 4 star rating instead of the 5 star rating - at least until some protection is added on.  There are grand stairs here in this house and most of them are wide enough for easy navigation.  However, the problem is the second set of 8-10 stairs leading from the third story on down to the second story level.  Be very careful on them as it is exceptionally easy to slip and fall (which I did).  Even though there is a bannister (which I was holding onto) the stairs are much more narrow with downward sloping edges from years of people walking on them compared to the other sections in the house.  Plus the carpet is that slippery, Victorian style which helps eliminate traction.  The owner needs to put some sort of rubber backing on the edges for additional safety, especially if older parents are staying here.

data.title: Perfect Location
data.text: I had the pleasure of staying in Hinds House this past October, and it was beautiful. The weekly rates are more than reasonable. The accommodation's were adequate for a long stay. They had everything we needed. I will go there again.

data.title: A great place to spend a week
data.text:
My husband was attending the Pickwick Universe at the university this summer and we found the Hinds House to be an excellent place for both of us. I wandered the shops and relaxed and he was able to get to the university by bus every day at the end of the road.
We had a small "blip" with our booking but they sorted that out with a quick telephone call and their arrrival on site.
It is an amazing property full of charm and character and your every need is catered for. So close to the town centre, walk everywhere and a great peaceful karma when you are inside your room.
You don't need to bring anything I can't recommend it enough.

data.title: Perfect Extended Stay in Downtown
data.text:
In the first two weeks of January I was contracted to work at a medical clinic in Santa Cruz.  I wanted to stay somewhere furnished where I could have a kitchen.  I was hoping to find someplace interesting and not too instututional like a standard hotel.  A friend told me about the Hinds House.  My stay was better than I could have ever imagined.  

This place is a beautifully maintained 1888 Victorian mansion with all the original woodwork and materials intact.  There are 10 guest rooms on two floors, some with shared baths (that's what I chose) and some with private baths.  The whole ground floor is divoted to common rooms where guests can lounge around in the parlor, play the grand piano in the sitting room or eat in the ornate dining room.  The main floor has a full kitchen that is equipped with everything down to baking supplies and salad spinners.  Each guest has designated space in a cupboard for food storage and space in one of three refrigerators.  The management has thought of everything: there is free wireless DSL, computer workstation, free laundry, full basement for bicycle and surfboard storage, private mailboxes and parking.  My room (#5) was beautiful and came with all that I needed including a VCR, CD player and work desk.  

The folks who own this place also run a B&B a few blocks away called the Adobe on Green Street and their experience at making places comfortable really shows.  My mattress was the most comfortable I have ever slept on.  Two of the best things about staying there were the location and the pricing.  Being on the corner of Church and Chestnut Streets, I was three blocks from the center of downtown.  I didn't have a car and I could walk to everything.  I never felt isolated or cut off from whatever I needed.  The prices are reasonable.  My room was $360 per week.  There are some rooms that are $300 per week.  The catch is there are no overnight stays.  All rates are by the week only.  All in all this was a special and rare place to be for a couple of weeks.  I just wish there were more places like this in other cities.

data.title: Buen lugar, a buen precio.
data.text: Este hotel es una casa antigua adaptada. El precio es muy bueno comparado con otros lugares de Santa Cruz. Casi todos los cuartos comparten baño, pero rara vez fue un problema tener que esperar a que se desocupe uno de los varios baños compartidos. Hay una cocina común equipada con refrigerador, alacena, micro-ondas, estufa y utensilios/loza suficiente (uno debe lavar los platos que usa). Hay varios cuartos para uso común para estudiar/leer. También es posible tener un permiso de estacionamiento sin costo adicional. Sin embargo, solamente se puede usar por al menos 7 días (luego pueden ser los días que sean), y los mejores cuartos son difíciles de conseguir: muchos clientes son regulares, y apartan con mucha anticipación.

data.title: Tolle Übernachtung!
data.text:
Wir waren schon zweimal im Hinds House und waren bisher immer sehr zufrieden. Am schönsten fanden wir das Zimmer 3 mit dem hübsch bemalten Waschbecken  - das Zimmer hat dazu eine gute Größe! Badezimmer mit Dusche (sind ganz oben im Haus, 3rd floor) oder ansonsten Badezimmer mit Toilette/Badewanne sind jeweils auf den Fluren (auch im second floor), die man sich dann mit anderen Gästen teilt. Hat bisher auch immer gut geklappt und Zähne kann man sich auch auf dem Zimmer putzen, da dort Waschbecken sind (ich glaub haben fast alle Zimmer). Es gibt auch Zimmer mit Bad (sind dann teurer). Unten im Haus befinden sich sehr schön eingerichtete Aufenthaltsräume, ein Laptop mit Internetzugang und eine riesengroße Küche, welche gut bestückt ist mit allem was man so braucht. Waschmaschinen und Trockner sind auch in einem extra Raum dafür vorhanden. Wir fanden diese Übernachtungsart am schönsten - da man sich dann auch mal selber was leckeres kochen kann und nicht immer nur auf den ganzen fast food Kram angewiesen ist. Gute Restaurants wie in Europa sind in Santa Cruz eher weniger vorhanden. Aber natürlich toller Strand und alles. Zu empfehlen ist 'Natural Bridges' - dort ist nicht nur ein toller Strand, sondern man kann dort auch schöne Schmetterlinge (Monarchen) in freier Wildbahn betrachten die dort ca. von Ende Oktober bis Ende Januar hinwandern aus kälteren Regionen um dort zu überwintern. Super schön! Auch noch sehr ans Herz zu legen ist der State Park 'Año Nuevo' in San Mateo Count, wo man eine See-Elephanten Kolonie sehen kann!

Wir werden auf jeden Fall demnächst wiederkommen, wenn wir mal wieder in Kalifornien sind!
